homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery from probate and certain non-probate assets if no protected heirs remain

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 4 months from notice to creditors; state may initiate probate if necessary

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: may be subject to recovery depending on transfer mechanism
additionalProtections: no recovery from estate of surviving spouse

administrative.agency: Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS), Estate Recovery Program (ERP)

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates and some non-probate assets including revocable trusts, joint tenancy, and life estates

legislationChanges: 2015 partial repeal of non-probate recovery elements

effectiveStrategies: use irrevocable trusts to protect assets from expanded recovery
avoid revocable trusts, joint tenancy, and life estates where possible
set up QIT early for over-income applicants
document hardship waiver eligibility in advance
